blocks.name: caa
blocks.content: Extend class notation to include the set of algebraic numbers.
blocks.origin: const class caa { AA }

blocks.name: diff.caa.s
diff.caa.c
diff.caa.w
df-aa
blocks.content: Define the set of algebraic numbers. An algebraic number is a root of a nonzero polynomial over the integers. Here we construct it as the union of all kernels (preimages of ` { 0 } ` ) of all polynomials in ` ( Poly `` ZZ ) ` , except the zero polynomial ` 0p ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Jul-2014.)

blocks.name: elaa
blocks.content: Elementhood in the set of algebraic numbers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Jul-2014.)

blocks.name: aacn

blocks.name: elqaalem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ elqaa . The function ` N ` represents the denominators of the rational coefficients ` B ` . By multiplying them all together to make ` R ` , we get a number big enough to clear all the denominators and make ` R x. F ` an integer polynomial. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Jul-2014.) (Revised by AV, 3-Oct-2020.)

blocks.name: elqaa
blocks.content: The set of numbers generated by the roots of polynomials in the _rational numbers_ is the same as the set of algebraic numbers, which by ~ elaa are defined only in terms of polynomials over the integers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Jul-2014.) (Proof shortened by AV, 3-Oct-2020.)

  |- wceq(caa, cuni(crn(c0)))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, cn0, crab(s1, cc, wrex(s2, crab(s3, cfv(cply, cz), w3a(wne(cv(s3), c0p), wbr(cfv(cdgr, cv(s3)), cle, cv(s0)), wral(s4, cn0, wbr(cfv(cabs, cfv(cfv(ccoe, cv(s3)), cv(s4))), cle, cv(s0))))), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s1)), nat0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)

  -| diffss(s2, s3)

} = {
